summary: This document appears to be a personnel list or organizational chart for Jeffrey Epstein's operations, detailing roles and names of pilots, employees, managers, and other staff associated with his transportation (TWA - likely Thomas World Air), properties (LSJE - likely Little St. James Estate), and local airport operations in St. Thomas.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Listed as the 'Principle' at the top of the personnel/organizational chart, indicating he is the central figure for whom all listed individuals work.

connections.description: Visoski is listed as the Head Pilot for Epstein's airline (TWA) and also as an LSJE employee, indicating direct employment.
Rodriquez is listed as the Manager for LSJE (Little St. James Estate), Epstein's property, indicating a direct supervisory role within his operations.
Rodriguez is listed as Head Boat Captain and an LSJE Escort, indicating roles in both transportation and guest services for Epstein.
Both are listed as pilots for TWA (Visoski as Head, Di Mauro as Assistant), indicating a working relationship within Epstein's air transport.
Rodriquez is listed as LSJE Manager and Vicars as Assistant Manager, indicating a direct supervisory relationship within the estate staff.
Both are listed as boat captains and LSJE escorts, indicating shared roles in maritime transport and guest services.
Romney is a manager for VIPA (Virgin Islands Port Authority), which operates the airport used by Epstein's flights, indicating a logistical or facilitative business connection.

locations: LSJE (Little St. James Estate) - St. Thomas
Cyril E. King Airport - St. Thomas
Thomas World Air Hanger - Jet Center STT
St. Thomas Jet Center FBO (Fixed Base Operation)
keyFacts: The document provides a structured list of staff and roles within Jeffrey Epstein's operations, centered on his St. Thomas estate (LSJE) and private airline (TWA).
It reveals the scale of Epstein's personal staff, including pilots, boat captains, housekeepers, landscapers, maintenance, and escorts, indicating a large, organized support system.
The list explicitly connects Epstein's air travel (TWA pilots) and maritime travel (boat captains) to his estate operations, highlighting integrated transportation logistics.
It identifies local business connections, such as Roy Romney of the Virgin Islands Port Authority (VIPA), showing Epstein's embeddedness in St. Thomas infrastructure.
The roles of 'LSJE Escorts' (Carlos Rodriguez, Ramon Linderman, Jermaine Ruan) are listed, which may be relevant to understanding guest and visitor logistics at the estate.
